reviewText: Bad...just bad. A teenager's version of Groundhog Day. I had high hopes because we love Bailee Madison and Zachary Gordon. Thought this would be a great family Christmas movie to add to our collection. Right off the bat, the magic of Santa is ruined. Beware, if hoping to watch with young children like I did. My little ones didn't "get" it, and it seemed to go right over my 8 year olds head (hopefully) I threw the dvd in the trash. Not happy with Santa being ruined in what seems to be like a movie geared for families. That, and the fact that the movie was just dumb and boring. Just to give you an idea...the parents are arguing because they both forgot to get their son Santa gifts, so the boy gets no gifts. Sad and depressing. Then, we get to watch the scene play out, over and over. Skip this one, it's THAT bad.

Bruce Dern, Molly Parker, and Bailee Madison light up the screen in this holiday charmer. I found myself laughing out loud and wiping away a tear or two. Sweet but not saccharine, redemptive but not heavy-handed, quirky but not French. Treat yourself to this low-calorie Christmas confection!

Not a must see...

If you are looking for a christmas movie that has a real story line... this is not it. This movie is the teenage christmas version of the movie groundhound day. I withheld judgement until after the first hour of the movie and waited... the second hour was not any better, just continuing the same story line of a teenager reliving Christmas day over and yes over again. To make a long story short do not waste your money on a holiday movie  that is not worth viewing. Stick with the basic classics like, a christmas carol, a christmas story, home alone, or the family stone.

I hate to be a scrooge, but hallmark missed the mark on this monstrosity of a movie.

Cute movie,
Thank You.
Kelli
groundhog day redo, with snow.  overly long and boring, with few redeeming scenarios.  hate to say this about a Christmas movie, but this should be called x-mas.
Very good movie

Charming family movie.  My 9 and 7 year old actually asked to repeat watch this movie two nights after we first viewed it. Simple,  but cute. Nothing inappropriate for children, with positive messages.

It is good, and to call it a Groundhog Day knockoff is wrong. This theme was used before Groundhog Day. I liked the movie except for one big thing. He repeats the day way too many times. He must have spent a whole month repeating it. You find yourself a quarter of the way in the movie saying, does he get it right yet? Aside from that it's good, would be five stars if it weren't for that. Not one I would watch every year but worth seeing once .

Picked this movie up for $5 and wasn't expecting much, but it far surpassed my expectations and is one of the best Christmas movies I have ever seen. Great plot, acting, and a terrific message and moral...... and a very clean movie and curse free making it a movie for the whole family.

This is actually a very enjoyable, entertaining movie for the holidays.  Even our college kids loved it.  It has become one of our favorite movies to watch during the holdiays.  Zach Gordon is engaging and fun to watch.  One of the best parts is when he and his grandpa (Bruce Dern) have a very heartfelt exchange in an ice cream parlor.  Very touching and great acting.  I would recommend this movie to anyone looking for a fun and entertaining holiday movie.
Fun holiday movie.
It was a cute family movie. The acting was good, especially 'Pete' & 'Grandpa'. Hallmark did a great job retelling the storyline!

My family (including 2 boys ages 10 and 13) really enjoyed this movie. I found it started off a little bit slow, but then picked up and we had some good laughs and everyone got the message of appreciating what you have. My sons actually did some picking up around the house after the movie and (at least for the night) were very into being helpful!! Hope that lasts!!!
Very fun, funny movie. Would recommend for people to watch.
luv this movie. got it for easter with 5 other movies. luv bailee

Great Family Fun. Middle Children will relate to Pete's delimma and hopefully find that there is a brightside to everything. reminiscent of groundhog day and Hallmark Christmas movies only better all the ends are nicely tied up in the end.
crazy movie will watch again
Good job.
Thank you, JBE
cute family movie.

I really enjoyed this, although the premise has been done several times before.  Pete had lots of troubles and it seemed like everything went wrong for him.  It was interesting to see how he managed to finally save his Christmas.
Similar plot to Ground Hog Day which is my favorite movie.
Was ok little slow moving for kids. They lost interest about the fourth time the day got repeated
Thanks!
very funny
This is a good movie. It has a teenager living the groundhog day over & over.
Think of a Christmas ground hog day. Actually a very good movie I'd watch again.

Stars Zachary Gordon,*, best known for his popular The Diary of a Wimpy Kid 1, 2 & 3 series that he'd outgrown. Teen-angst co-star ,~*~, Bailee Madison is the new nextdoor neighbor from Wisconsin. Also stars Bruce Dern (a favorite of mine since the '60s.) Times have changed, now that I am in MY sixties, things are starting to un- ravel... like a very old comfortable sweater... I remember the best of times... and forgive short-comings. I enjoyed this mish-mash of 12:01/Ground Hog Day, in fact, I was hoping for a kiss-exchange between Zachary and Bailee's characters. Perhaps their ages made it inappropriate. Ms Madison and Master Gordon are older than their years. I'll leave a footnote about their most-recent endeavors on film: */\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\* ZACHARY GORDON's screen credits (Born FEB '98{approaching 17}) since 2 episodes of 2009's series "24". Stine's The Haunting Hour: Series; ''The Incredible Burt Wonderstone'' 2013: The movie reviewed, here.; Cartoon Network: Uncle Grandpa "Benny", 1 episode; LAST MAN STANDING: 3 episodes. 2014: "The Boxcar Children"{voice-actor; Cartoon Network: Clarence "Ned" voice-actor; NORM OF THE NORTH {voice}. 2015: The, yet to be released, BILL & TED'S EXCELLENT ADVENTURE{role of Ted Logan}. ~*~/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\/\~*~ BAILEE MADISON (Born OCT '99{15, now}) has a heck of a lot of screen credits. I'll just list recent ones. 2011: COWGIRLS 'N' ANGELS; A TASTE OF ROMANCE; SMART COOKIES; PARENTAL GUIDANCE; MONICA. 2012: R.L.STINE'S THE HAUNTING HOUR: 2 episodes; Once Upon a Time: {Young Snow White};Holliston: {"Bailee"}. 2013: THE MAGIC BRACELET; HALF; ^PETE'S CHRISTMAS^; Trophy Wife{series' regular}; THE FOSTERS: SERIES, season 2. 2014: NORTHPOLE 2015: NORTHPOLE 2--- announced pre-release.

I felt like I had seen this movie before. Oh wait it was an old abc family movie from the 90s titled "Christmas every day" which is essentially the same movie with a slightly different subplot. All in all it was a cute and enjoyable movie.
Great family movie!

As "modern" Christmas movies go, this one is fun and semi-classic. Yes the concept of reliving days has been done before but it's presented in a fairly unique situation in this movie. And it's from the perspective of a young man with siblings, which presents it's own twists. Worth watching and fun for the kids as well.

As others have pointed out, this film is essentially "Groundhog Day" set at Christmas with a younger protagonist. That's not a revelation. Anyone who has seen both films will catch the clear references to "Groundhog Day" in this film. And if I were rating this film based only on originality, it would get a very low score indeed. But the target audience for this probably will not have seen "Groundhog Day," and even so, the idea of repeating time is was not necessarily invented for "Groundhog Day." (See, for example, "12:01," which was a television movie released in the same year as "Groundhog Day.")

The premise is simple. Pete's Christmas does not go well. His parents forget to get him a gift, his brother blames him for things he didn't do, and his grandfather visits only to feel slighted and leave. Oh, well. Not every Christmas can be good. When Pete awakens the next day, it's Christmas yet again. And again. And again, and so forth. And as we go through probably hundreds of Christmases, Pete learns and one by one tries to right the wrongs of the first Christmas. In doing so, he learns a fair amount. I'll give an example that won't ruin much of the film, but it's a bit of a spoiler, so skip the next paragraph if you'd rather not have any more of the plot revealed.

As part of Christmas day, Pete and his brother play in a football game against the neighbors. At first, the neighbors win, as, it seems, they always do. But given the chance to relive the same day repeatedly, Pete realizes that he can win the game since he knows what the other team will do. And so he does--only to find out that his brother, the football star, is not satisfied. So Pete finds another way to win the game, this time addressing his brother's concerns. (Oh, and the solution seems silly and contrived.)

Certainly not the greatest film ever made, "Pete's Christmas" does have a certain charm and does seem to have its heart in the right place. And Bruce Dern as the cranky grandfather is lots of fun.
I love this movie!  I had to add it to our families Christmas movie collection!
received

Cute movie that's clean and you can watch with your children.  Wish they made more movies like it.  My kids are 11 and 5 and they liked it.  If you like the general write up of the story line, buy it.  It's cute.
My 10 yr old daughter early liked this movie
This is still on the DVR from last Christmas from the Hallmark Channel. Excellent family movie.

This is a great movie to add to your holiday collection.  It moves quickly with many twists and turns and is a delight for the whole family!  You won't be disappointed.  It's a real charmer, quite funny and very entertaining with a good story line!

A very good 'Ground Hog Day' for children.  Good young actors/actress with a good cast tell a good story about how it feels to be the middle child, even though some is a bit far fetched.  It was well worth watching and I am glad I added it to my collection.
Pete's Christmas is a remake of a Christmas show many years ago.....I loved it so much, I had to buy it after seeing it on TV at Christmas time.  To me it is rated 5 stars, great story

This "Grounhog Day"-type movie is charming with a nice message!  A recurring Christmas Day gone awry is extremely irritating to Pete, until someone points out that it's actualy a gift.  That's when Pete starts to change things for the better.  I never get tired of watching it.

A children's version of groundhog day. My kids liked it better than that movie, they could relate to the situations better. For example,  the protagonist deals with (and eventually triumphs over) sibling rivalry/jealousy, bullying, chores, parent's unemployment, grumpy grandparents, etc... My children 'got it' and really enjoyed it. You have to like redemption stories, though.

This movie was swesome! In the play "Our Town" the main character says that life goes too fast that we do not have time to look at one another.  In this story, Pete has time to live life deeply. His grandfater gives him an empty box for Christmas, and Pete comes to realize that life is not what we get out of it, it is what we put into it.  With each time around, he learns more and is able to put more into life with his incresed knowledge. First he improves life for himself and realizes the joy of improving life for others.
As the storylines main focus is on the early teen in this movie -  it is great for that age group - overall a Fun family movie
Our family enjoyed this Christmas movie.
Great movie

I really didn't like this movie at first.  The kids were mean to each other and no one was really very pleasant.  But as the days progressed, the main character discovered that he could change AND make a difference in his own life.  He realized that he liked his family and most of the things that they did for Christmas and other days of the year.  Bruce Dern turned in another stellar performance, playing the crotchety grandfather who turns out to be better than he seems.  By the end of the movie, I was enjoying it quite a bit.  It did take a lot of story line from a movie that came out several years ago called (if I remember correctly) Christmas Every Day, but they put a different spin on it, so it didn't make that much difference.  It's a nice family movie to watch.  Probably won't be a family favorite (but it might be) but it will be enjoyed.
Such a funny and sweet family movie!
Very entertaining for the whole family
Funny and clean. Nice to find a clean movie these days.

Even though I haven't seen this version yet but I am completely basing this off of the the 90s version ChristmasEverydat starring Erik Van Detten. Just like I enjoyed the first one when I was a child from the preview alone I know this is something that I will enjoy watching with my nephew.
My 6 year old daughter loves this movie!

This movie is ok. It's a Christmas Movie when some of your Family Members ( like mine) likes to ruin your Christmas Sprit from there bad attitude! It's sad that they do that but they don't care. There are some funny scene's in this movie and a Happy Ending.
